revised_title: Effects of Sleep Deprivation on Complex System Operation and Performance
tldr: This study investigates the effects of sleep deprivation on the performance of individuals operating complex systems, such as a ground control station for remotely piloted air vehicles. The research found that while cognitive performance deteriorated over time, performance on the complex system remained stable. The findings suggest that designing systems with a focus on ergonomics and user interactions can help maintain performance during extended periods of sleep deprivation.
